sect1.title: Who wrote the Yellow Duck Framework?
sect1.para: Pieter Claerhout (www.yellowduck.be) wrote the initial Yellow Duck Framework and is still maintaining it.

sect1.title: Where can I get support for the Yellow Duck Framework?
sect1.para: Currently, the only way to get support is to use the online support forum. This forum can be found on the following location: .

sect1.title: Is there a mailing list?
sect1.para: No, there is no mailing list and there are no plans to create one.

sect1.title: How can I contribute?
sect1.para: If you want to contribute code, you can request write access to the Subversion server by sending an email to pieter@yellowduck.be. However, there are some rules you need to keep in mind when you are contributing code to this project:

itemizedlist.listitem: All you classes should contain DoxyGen docstrings so that they are automatically included in the API documentation.
All class names should start with the characters "YD".
All constants should start with the characters "YD_".
Provide an example (preferable a lot of examples) on how to use the class.
Provide documentation about the class you wrote so that this can be included in the standard documentation.
